<g1>KeyPress</g1> <g2>(KeyCode </g2><g3>As</g3><g4> </g4><g5>Int</g5><g6>) </g6><g7>As</g7><g8> </g8><g9>Boolean</g9><x1/>Event raised when the user presses a physical or virtual key.<x2/>KeyCode is the code of the pressed key, you can get them with the KeyCodes keyword.<x3/><x4/><x5/>The event can return either:<x6/>-  True, the event is 'consumed', considered by the operating system as already executed and    no further action is taken.<x7/>-  False, the event is not consumed and transmitted to the system for further actions.

<x8/>Example:<x9/><g10>Sub </g10><g11>Activity_KeyPress</g11><g12>(KeyCode </g12><g13>As</g13><g14> </g14><g15>Int</g15><g16>) </g16><g17>As</g17><g18> </g18><g19>Boolean<x10/>  </g19><g20>Private</g20><g21> Answ </g21><g22>As</g22><g23> </g23><g24>Int<x11/>  </g24><g25>Private</g25><g26> Txt </g26><g27>As</g27><g28> </g28><g29>String<x12/>  <x13/>  </g29><g30>If</g30><g31> KeyCode = </g31><g32>KeyCodes</g32><g33>.KEYCODE_BACK </g33><g34>Then<x14/></g34><g35>' Checks if KeyCode is BackKey<x15/>    </g35><g36>Txt = </g36><g37>"Do you really want to quit the program ?"<x16/>    </g37><g38>Answ = </g38><g39>Msgbox2</g39><g40>(Txt,</g40><g41>"A T T E N T I O N"</g41><g42>,</g42><g43>"Yes"</g43><g44>,</g44><g45>""</g45><g46>,</g46><g47>"No"</g47><g48>,</g48><g49>Null</g49><g50>)</g50><g51>' MessageBox<x17/>    </g51><g52>If</g52><g53> Answ = </g53><g54>DialogResponse</g54><g55>.POSITIVE </g55><g56>Then  </g56><g57>' If return value is Yes then<x18/>      </g57><g58>Return</g58><g59> </g59><g60>False    </g60><g61>' Return = False  the Event will not be consumed<x19/>    </g61><g62>Else</g62><g63><x20/>   </g63><g64>' <x21/>   we leave the program<x22/>      </g64><g65>Return</g65><g66> </g66><g67>True</g67><g68><x23/>   </g68><g69>' Return = True   the Event will be consumed to avoid<x24/>    </g69><g70>End</g70><g71> </g71><g72>If</g72><g73><x25/>   </g73><g74>'                 leaving the program<x26/>  </g74><g75>End</g75><g76> </g76><g77>If<x27/>End Sub</g77>

<x8/>Example:<x9/><g10>Sub </g10><g11>Activity_KeyPress</g11><g12>(KeyCode </g12><g13>As</g13><g14> </g14><g15>Int</g15><g16>) </g16><g17>As</g17><g18> </g18><g19>Boolean<x10/>  </g19><g20>Private</g20><g21> Answ </g21><g22>As</g22><g23> </g23><g24>Int<x11/>  </g24><g25>Private</g25><g26> Txt </g26><g27>As</g27><g28> </g28><g29>String<x12/>  <x13/>  </g29><g30>If</g30><g31> KeyCode = </g31><g32>KeyCodes</g32><g33>.KEYCODE_BACK </g33><g34>Then<x14/></g34><g35>' Checks if KeyCode is BackKey<x15/>    </g35><g36>Txt = </g36><g37>"Do you really want to quit the program ?"<x16/>    </g37><g38>Answ = </g38><g39>Msgbox2</g39><g40>(Txt,</g40><g41>"A T T E N T I O N"</g41><g42>,</g42><g43>"Yes"</g43><g44>,</g44><g45>""</g45><g46>,</g46><g47>"No"</g47><g48>,</g48><g49>Null</g49><g50>)</g50><g51>' MessageBox<x17/>    </g51><g52>If</g52><g53> Answ = </g53><g54>DialogResponse</g54><g55>.POSITIVE </g55><g56>Then  </g56><g57>' If return value is Yes then<x18/>      </g57><g58>Return</g58><g59> </g59><g60>False    </g60><g61>' Return = False  the Event will not be consumed<x19/>    </g61><g62>Else</g62><g63><x20/>   </g63><g64>' <x21/>   we leave the program<x22/>      </g64><g65>Return</g65><g66> </g66><g67>True</g67><g68><x23/>   </g68><g69>' Return = True   the Event will be consumed to avoid<x24/>    </g69><g70>End</g70><g71> </g71><g72>If</g72><g73><x25/>   </g73><g74>'                 leaving the program<x26/>  </g74><g75>End</g75><g76> </g76><g77>If<x27/>End Sub</g77>

<g1>Click</g1><x1/>Event raised when the user clicks on the view.<x2/>Example:<x3/><g2>Private Sub </g2><g3>Button1_Click</g3><g4><x4/>  </g4><g5>' Your code<x5/></g5><g6>End Sub<x6/></g6>
<g1>Click</g1><x1/>Event raised when the user clicks on the view.<x2/>Example:<x3/><g2>Private Sub </g2><g3>Button1_Click</g3><g4><x4/>  </g4><g5>' Your code<x5/></g5><g6>End Sub<x6/></g6>

<g1>LongClick</g1><x1/>Event raised when the user clicks on the view and holds it pressed for a while.<x2/>Example:<x3/><g2>Private Sub </g2><g3>Button1_LongClick</g3><g4><x4/>  </g4><g5>' Your code<x5/></g5><g6>End Sub<x6/></g6>

<g1>LongClick</g1><x1/>Event raised when the user clicks on the view and holds it pressed for a while.<x2/>Example:<x3/><g2>Private Sub </g2><g3>Button1_LongClick</g3><g4><x4/>  </g4><g5>' Your code<x5/></g5><g6>End Sub<x6/></g6>

<g1>Touch<x1/></g1><g2>(Action </g2><g3>As</g3><g4> </g4><g5>Int</g5><g6>, X </g6><g7>As</g7><g8> </g8><g9>Float</g9><g10>, Y </g10><g11>As</g11><g12> </g12><g13>Float</g13><g14>)<x2/></g14>Event raised when the user touches a Panel on the screen.

<g1>Touch<x1/></g1><g2>(Action </g2><g3>As</g3><g4> </g4><g5>Int</g5><g6>, X </g6><g7>As</g7><g8> </g8><g9>Float</g9><g10>, Y </g10><g11>As</g11><g12> </g12><g13>Float</g13><g14>)<x2/></g14>Event raised when the user touches a Panel on the screen.

<x3/>Three different actions are handled:<x4/>-  Panel.ACTION_DOWN,<x5/>the user touches the screen.<x6/>-  Panel.ACTION_MOVE,<x7/>the user moves the finger without leaving the screen.<x8/>-  Panel.ACTION_UP,<x9/>the user leaves the screen.<x10/>The X and Y coordinates of the finger positions are given in Points not in Pixels.<x11/>Example:<x12/><g15>Private Sub </g15><g16>Panel_Touch</g16><g17> (Action </g17><g18>As</g18><g19> </g19><g20>Int</g20><g21>, X </g21><g22>As</g22><g23> </g23><g24>Float</g24><g25>, Y </g25><g26>As</g26><g27> </g27><g28>Float</g28><g29>)<x13/>  </g29><g30>Select</g30><g31> Action<x14/>  </g31><g32>Case</g32><g33> </g33><g34>Panel.</g34><g35>ACTION_DOWN<x15/>    </g35><g36>' Your code for DOWN action<x16/>  </g36><g37>Case</g37><g38> </g38><g39>Panel</g39><g40>.ACTION_MOVE<x17/>    </g40><g41>' Your code for MOVE action</g41><g42><x18/>  </g42><g43>Case</g43><g44> </g44><g45>Panel</g45><g46>.ACTION_UP<x19/>    </g46><g47>' Your code for UP action</g47><g48><x20/>  </g48><g49>End</g49><g50> </g50><g51>Select<x21/>End Sub<x22/><x23/><x24/></g51>

<x3/>Three different actions are handled:<x4/>-  Panel.ACTION_DOWN,<x5/>the user touches the screen.<x6/>-  Panel.ACTION_MOVE,<x7/>the user moves the finger without leaving the screen.<x8/>-  Panel.ACTION_UP,<x9/>the user leaves the screen.<x10/>The X and Y coordinates of the finger positions are given in Points not in Pixels.<x11/>Example:<x12/><g15>Private Sub </g15><g16>Panel_Touch</g16><g17> (Action </g17><g18>As</g18><g19> </g19><g20>Int</g20><g21>, X </g21><g22>As</g22><g23> </g23><g24>Float</g24><g25>, Y </g25><g26>As</g26><g27> </g27><g28>Float</g28><g29>)<x13/>  </g29><g30>Select</g30><g31> Action<x14/>  </g31><g32>Case</g32><g33> </g33><g34>Panel.</g34><g35>ACTION_DOWN<x15/>    </g35><g36>' Your code for DOWN action<x16/>  </g36><g37>Case</g37><g38> </g38><g39>Panel</g39><g40>.ACTION_MOVE<x17/>    </g40><g41>' Your code for MOVE action</g41><g42><x18/>  </g42><g43>Case</g43><g44> </g44><g45>Panel</g45><g46>.ACTION_UP<x19/>    </g46><g47>' Your code for UP action</g47><g48><x20/>  </g48><g49>End</g49><g50> </g50><g51>Select<x21/>End Sub<x22/><x23/><x24/></g51>

<g1>Touch<x1/></g1><g2>(Action </g2><g3>As</g3><g4> </g4><g5>Int</g5><g6>, X </g6><g7>As</g7><g8> </g8><g9>Float</g9><g10>, Y </g10><g11>As</g11><g12> </g12><g13>Float</g13><g14>)<x2/></g14>Event raised when the user ‘touches’ the screen.

<x3/>This event is similar to the Touch events in B4A and B4i.<x4/>Three different actions are handled:<x5/>-  Pane1.<g15>TOUCH_</g15>ACTION_DOWN, the user touches the screen.<x6/>-  Pane1.<g16>TOUCH_</g16>ACTION_MOVE, the user moves the finger without leaving the screen.<x7/>-  Pane1.<g17>TOUCH_</g17>ACTION_UP,<x8/>  the user leaves the screen.<x9/>The X an Y coordinates of the mouse cursor position are given.<x10/>Example:<x11/><g18>Sub </g18><g19>Pane1_Touch</g19><g20> (Action </g20><g21>As</g21><g22> </g22><g23>Int</g23><g24>, X </g24><g25>As</g25><g26> </g26><g27>Float</g27><g28>, Y </g28><g29>As</g29><g30> </g30><g31>Float</g31><g32>)<x12/>  </g32><g33>Select</g33><g34> Action<x13/>  </g34><g35>Case</g35><g36> </g36><g37>Pane1</g37><g38>.TOUCH_ACTION_DOWN<x14/>    </g38><g39>' Your code for DOWN action<x15/>  </g39><g40>Case</g40><g41> </g41><g42>Pane1</g42><g43>.TOUCH_ACTION_MOVE<x16/>    </g43><g44>' Your code for MOVE action</g44><g45><x17/>  </g45><g46>Case</g46><g47> </g47><g48>Pane1</g48><g49>.TOUCH_ACTION_UP<x18/>    </g49><g50>' Your code for UP action</g50><g51><x19/>  </g51><g52>End</g52><g53> </g53><g54>Select<x20/>End Sub</g54><x21/>or<x22/><g55>Sub </g55><g56>Pane1_Touch</g56><g57> (Action </g57><g58>As</g58><g59> </g59><g60>Int</g60><g61>, X </g61><g62>As</g62><g63> </g63><g64>Float</g64><g65>, Y </g65><g66>As</g66><g67> </g67><g68>Float</g68><g69>)<x23/>  </g69><g70>Select</g70><g71> Action<x24/>  </g71><g72>Case</g72><g73> 0  </g73><g74>'DOWN</g74><g75><x25/>    </g75><g76>' Your code for DOWN action<x26/>  </g76><g77>Case</g77><g78> </g78><g79>2  </g79><g80>'MOVE</g80><g81><x27/>    </g81><g82>' Your code for MOVE action</g82><g83><x28/>  </g83><g84>Case</g84><g85> 1  </g85><g86>'UP</g86><g87><x29/>    </g87><g88>' Your code for UP action</g88><g89><x30/>  </g89><g90>End</g90><g91> </g91><g92>Select<x31/>End Sub<x32/></g92>
